titleStmt.title: The extravagant youth, or, An emblem of prodigality. Tho' he was stout he can't get out, in trouble he'l remain young-men be wise, your freedom prize, bad company refrain. To the tune of, King James's jigg; or, The country farmer.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Deacon, and the Angel in Guiltspur-Street,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "Come listen a while and I will relate ..."
Item at A5:2[114] imperfect: trimmed, affecting imprint.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
